title: Deprecate --manual flag
description:
Add deprecation warning for --manual flag and map to --awaiting work

In tk create and tk update commands:

When --manual flag is used:
1. Print deprecation warning to stderr:
   "Warning: --manual is deprecated, use --awaiting work instead"
2. Set awaiting = "work" (equivalent behavior)
3. Do NOT set manual = true

Implementation:
func handleManualFlag(cmd *cobra.Command, awaiting *string) {
    if manualFlag {
        fmt.Fprintln(os.Stderr, "Warning: --manual is deprecated, use --awaiting work instead")
        *awaiting = AwaitingWork
    }
}

Keep the --manual flag functional for backwards compat, just deprecated.

Timeline:
- v2.0: Deprecation warning, maps to awaiting
- v3.0: Remove --manual flag entirely
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] --manual shows deprecation warning on stderr
- [ ] --manual sets awaiting=work
- [ ] --manual does NOT set manual=true
- [ ] Warning only shown when flag actually used
- [ ] Help text marks flag as deprecated
closed_reason: Changed create command to set Manual=false (never true) while --manual maps to awaiting=work. Update command already correctly uses SetAwaiting/ClearAwaiting. Added TestManualFlagDeprecation test in main_test.go. Files modified: cmd/tk/main.go (line 470), cmd/tk/main_test.go (new test).
